health_data.description: Activity and health metrics from Apple Health or other health tracking platforms

items.name: Chronological Age
items.description: Your current age in years

items.name: Biological Sex
items.description: Biological sex assigned at birth (used for health metric comparisons)

items.name: Daily Steps
items.description: Average daily step count over the past week
items.age_impact: Regular physical activity correlates with lower biological age. Consistently hitting 10,000+ steps may reduce biological age by 1-2 years.

items.name: Sleep Duration
items.description: Average nightly sleep duration over the past week
items.age_impact: Chronic sleep deprivation accelerates biological aging. Each hour below 7 hours may add 0.5-1 year to biological age.

items.name: Active Calories
items.description: Average daily active calories burned
items.age_impact: Higher active energy expenditure correlates with lower biological age and reduced mortality risk.

bio_age_tests.description: Functional tests that correlate with biological age

items.name: Continuous Push-ups
items.description: Maximum number of push-ups completed in one set
items.age_impact: Push-up capacity inversely correlates with cardiovascular disease risk and biological age.

items.name: Grip Strength (Dominant)
items.description: Maximum grip strength of the dominant hand
items.age_impact: Grip strength is a strong predictor of longevity and biological age. Each 10% reduction below age-expected strength may add 1-2 years to biological age.

items.name: One-Leg Stand
items.description: Duration able to stand on one leg with eyes closed
items.age_impact: Balance ability correlates with brain health and lower biological age.

capabilities.description: Broader functional health capabilities beyond standard bio age tests

items.name: VO2 Max
items.description: Maximum oxygen consumption during exercise
items.age_impact: Higher cardiorespiratory fitness correlates with lower biological age. Each 5 ml/kg/min increase above average may reduce biological age by 2-3 years.

items.name: Cognitive Processing Speed
items.description: Reaction time in cognitive processing tasks
items.age_impact: Faster cognitive processing speed correlates with lower biological age and better brain health.

items.name: Heart Rate Recovery
items.description: Decrease in heart rate one minute after peak exercise
items.age_impact: Faster heart rate recovery indicates better autonomic function and correlates with lower biological age.

biomarkers.description: Standard medical biomarkers from blood and urine tests

items.name: HbA1c
items.description: Measures average blood glucose levels over the past 2-3 months
items.age_impact: Higher HbA1c correlates with increased biological age. Each 1% increase above optimal may add 4-6 years to biological age.

items.name: Fasting Glucose
items.description: Measures blood sugar levels after an overnight fast
items.age_impact: Elevated fasting glucose accelerates aging through glycation and oxidative stress. Levels above 100 mg/dL may add 2-3 years to biological age.

items.name: hs-CRP
items.description: Marker of systemic inflammation
items.age_impact: Chronic inflammation accelerates cellular aging. CRP levels above 3.0 mg/L may add 3-4 years to biological age.

items.name: Body Fat Percentage
items.description: Percentage of total body mass that is fat
items.age_impact: Higher body fat percentage, especially visceral fat, correlates with increased biological age.

items.name: Waist-to-Height Ratio
items.description: Ratio of waist circumference to height
items.age_impact: Higher waist-to-height ratio correlates with increased metabolic risk and biological age.

items.name: Muscle Mass
items.description: Total skeletal muscle mass
items.age_impact: Higher muscle mass correlates with lower biological age and improved metabolic health.

lab_results.description: Advanced lab tests including epigenetic and other aging tests

items.name: Telomere Length
items.description: Average length of telomeres in white blood cells
items.age_impact: Shorter telomeres directly correlate with increased biological age. Each 1kb reduction below average for age may add 3-5 years to biological age.

items.name: DNA Methylation Age
items.description: Epigenetic biological age based on DNA methylation patterns
items.age_impact: DNA methylation age is one of the most accurate measures of biological age.

items.name: GlycanAge
items.description: Biological age based on glycan profiles
items.age_impact: Glycan profiles provide insight into immune system aging and overall biological age.
